text: [music playing]

BANA ALABED: I love Turkey,
snow, and safe, and peace.

But I am sad for the children
of Syria, the bombing.
[speaking arabic]
FATEMAH ALABED: I have a--
a beautiful life.
I have everything.

But sometimes I
feel am in Aleppo.

We just arrived,
and my son saw the--

the sweets, saw
apple, banana, said,
mum, mum, we are in heaven!
We are in heaven!

And when I hear this,
I was very, very sad,

because he don't know
anything about the world.

Just he knows that
the world is just war.

And we told we-- our
children that in heaven,

there is a lot of
sweet things like this,
and we make them imagine.

So when he saw this, he
thought he is in the heaven.
BANA ALABED: [speaking arabic]
